column5: Anybody have the latest ice depths at red lake, on. Going there in Mid-May. Last year there still was ice on the lake.

I fished three lakes around red lake over the weekend :Gullrock 45in. Parker 30in. Petersen (for laketrout) 36in. My ? for RedLake is 40in. It's going to be above freezing this week with some rain. no snow on the ice, should go fast when it starts.
So how did you do fishing this weekend? I hear there are alot of gold prospectors in Red Lake.

Me and the wife fished Gullrock from 3:30 to 7:oopm 17 sauger 3 ling 1 10 pound jack (canadian for northern eh) sunday ernie wright from lakeside marine and I went for lakers caught 5 we went 30mi. into the park. went to parker the same day for some walleye for supper. The gold rush is on, but most of thre drilling rigs are off the lakes.When are you coming up to Mikes?

We are coming up on the 21st of June. Mike called on Sunday.He and Gerri are doing well. They are leaving this Sat. and will spend 3-4 days in spooner, Wisc and then on to camp.Saw a couple of your clients the other day. Gary Sampson and Marlin Kalous. Marlin just had back surgery. He is not doing real well.
Bud,So when do think the ice will go out this spring?I see the forcast looks warmer.About what date do you consider normal ice out forGull Rock??

Hi Bud, next time you see Ernie tell him to give Walter my best wishes. I heard Walter had some sort of snow machine accident and is going to be slowed up for some time. Walter will be in my thoughts and prayers. I will stop in the shop in June when I get up there. Thanks.

John, thanks for info, we'll have to mike and Gerri over for some fresh walleyesAl, walter was in a snowmobile accident and broke his pelvis I havn't seen him since must be taking it easy at home.Bruce, I say nomal Ice to be May 6th
